title: How to Install a New Part in Need for Speed

methods.name: Installing a New Part in NFS: Carbon (PC)

steps.headline: Launch the game.
steps.description: You can do this from the Start menu (Start Button >> All Programs >> Electronic Arts >> Need for Speed Carbon) or from the desktop by double-clicking its icon.

steps.headline: Access the main menu.
steps.description: When the game loads, press Enter to display the main menu.

steps.headline: Open career mode.
steps.description: Choose the first option on the main menu, Career, by pressing Enter.

steps.headline: Continue your career.
steps.description: On the Career menu, choose “Resume Career.” This will take you to the Safe House you accessed most recently or the one nearest to the point you last were in the game world. A Safe House is a hideout in the game world that offers respite from the cops and where you can customize your car(s) and manage your racing crew. Depending on your career progress, there may one or several Safe Houses scattered all over the game world (a fictional city called Palmont).

steps.headline: Open the Safe House menu.
steps.description: The Safe House menu allows you to install different types of parts on your car.

steps.headline: Begin customizing a new performance part.
steps.description: On the Safe House menu scroll rightwards and choose “Customization” by pressing Enter.

steps.headline: Go to Performance.
steps.description: On the Customization menu scroll rightwards and choose “Performance” by pressing Enter.

steps.headline: Select a category for performance upgrade.
steps.description: On the Performance menu, the following categories of upgrades are available: Engine, Transmission, Suspension, Nitrous, Tires, Brakes, and Turbo. Select which category you'll be upgrading by scrolling downward or upward (Down or Up Arrow key, respectively) to highlight the category you want then pressing Enter.

steps.headline: Select an upgrade.
steps.description: There are different upgrades in each category, and each is priced according to how much it improves your car. Scroll downward or upward (Down or Up Arrow key respectively) to highlight the upgrade you want and press Enter to choose it. This will put the upgrade in your shopping cart.

steps.headline: Exit the Performance Customization menu.
steps.description: Once you have selected all the performance parts you want, press Escape to return to the Customization menu.

steps.headline: Begin installing a new visual part.
steps.description: Everything else on the NFS Carbon Customization menu (apart from the Performance section) is pretty much dedicated to improving the visual appearance of the car. These sections are: Autosculpt, Aftermarket and Visuals. The Aftermarket section allows you to install visual parts that are not by default installed on the car by the manufacturer while the Visuals section mostly tackles paint. In Autosculpt, you can modify Aftermarket parts like Bumpers and Roof Scoops to better suite you car. The procedure for installing a visual part is like that of a performance part, but the order is important, as shown in the next steps.

steps.headline: Start off with the Aftermarket section.
steps.description: Scrolling rightwards on the Customization menu and pressing Enter when the category you want is highlighted.

steps.headline: Select an Aftermarket category.
steps.description: The categories under Aftermarket include: Body Kit, Hood, and Wheels. Use the Left and Right Arrow keys to scroll from a category to the next.

steps.headline: Select an Aftermarket upgrade.
steps.description: Use the Down and Up Arrow keys to highlight the upgrades/parts under the categories. Pressing Enter will put the part into your shopping cart.

steps.headline: Go to Visuals.
steps.description: After Aftermarket, return to the Customization menu (Escape) and choose “Visuals.” Here you can select the paint color for different parts of the car, i.e., Body and Wheels. Scroll rightwards on the Visuals section and press Enter when the category you want is highlighted.

steps.headline: Select a Visual category.
steps.description: Use the Left and Right Arrow keys to scroll from a category to the next.

steps.headline: Select a Visual upgrade.
steps.description: Use the Down and Up Arrow keys to highlight the upgrades/parts under the categories. Pressing Enter will put the part into your shopping cart.

steps.headline: Go to Autosculpt.
steps.description: After Visuals, return to the Customization menu (Escape) and choose “Autosculpt.” This is where you can modify the parts added from Aftermarket to your tastes.

steps.headline: Select an Autosculpt upgrade.
steps.description: Categories under Autosculpt are identical those under Aftermarket and can be selected by scrolling leftwards or rightwards and pressing Enter. The Left and Right Arrow keys can be used to alter the parts, e.g., the positioning of a Roof Scoop or the height of a Bumper.

steps.headline: Purchase your upgrade.
steps.description: The last part is to pay for the upgrades in the shopping cart and thus apply them to the car. Press Spacebar to view the shopping cart and Enter to complete the process. At this point, your car is much better than when you entered the Safe House!

methods.name: Installing a New Part in NFS Most Wanted 2012 (PC)

steps.headline: Launch the game.
steps.description: You can launch it from the Start Menu (Start Button >> All Program >> Electronic Arts >> Need for Speed Most Wanted) or from the desktop by double-clicking its icon. When it finishes loading, the game will launch directly into the game world.

steps.headline: Open the EasyDrive menu.
steps.description: Use the EasyDrive system to find races. EasyDrive is an in-game menu in the game that provides functions such as Customization, Race Selection, Car Changing, and Multiplayer. Press number 6 to bring up the EasyDrive Menu.

steps.headline: Go to Races.
steps.description: Use number 2 to scroll down to the Races option and press number 6 to view available races.

steps.headline: View available racs.
steps.description: Use number 8 and number 2 to scroll up and down respectively among the available races.

steps.headline: Select a race.
steps.description: To accept a race, scroll down (number 2) to Start Race and press number 6 again. This will get you into the race.

steps.headline: Go back to the EasyDrive menu.
steps.description: After winning the race, any unlocked parts will be available on the EasyDrive menu. Press number 6 to bring it up.

steps.headline: Go to Customize Car.
steps.description: To do this, scroll to Customize Car using number 2.

steps.headline: Select a customization option.
steps.description: Under Customize Car, you will find the following categories: Tires, Nitrous, Chassis, Body, and Transmission. Scroll to the part you unlocked (number 2 and number 8) by winning your race and press number 6 to select it.

steps.headline: Install the upgrade.
steps.description: Press number 6 again to install the part.

text: Installing a New Part in NFS: Carbon (PC) Launch the game. You can do this from the Start menu (Start Button >> All Programs >> Electronic Arts >> Need for Speed Carbon) or from the desktop by double-clicking its icon. Access the main menu. When the game loads, press Enter to display the main menu. Open career mode. Choose the first option on the main menu, Career, by pressing Enter. Continue your career. On the Career menu, choose “Resume Career.” This will take you to the Safe House you accessed most recently or the one nearest to the point you last were in the game world. A Safe House is a hideout in the game world that offers respite from the cops and where you can customize your car(s) and manage your racing crew. Depending on your career progress, there may one or several Safe Houses scattered all over the game world (a fictional city called Palmont). Open the Safe House menu. The Safe House menu allows you to install different types of parts on your car. Begin customizing a new performance part. On the Safe House menu scroll rightwards and choose “Customization” by pressing Enter. Go to Performance. On the Customization menu scroll rightwards and choose “Performance” by pressing Enter. Select a category for performance upgrade. On the Performance menu, the following categories of upgrades are available: Engine, Transmission, Suspension, Nitrous, Tires, Brakes, and Turbo. Select which category you'll be upgrading by scrolling downward or upward (Down or Up Arrow key, respectively) to highlight the category you want then pressing Enter. Select an upgrade. There are different upgrades in each category, and each is priced according to how much it improves your car. Scroll downward or upward (Down or Up Arrow key respectively) to highlight the upgrade you want and press Enter to choose it. This will put the upgrade in your shopping cart. Exit the Performance Customization menu. Once you have selected all the performance parts you want, press Escape to return to the Customization menu. Begin installing a new visual part. Everything else on the NFS Carbon Customization menu (apart from the Performance section) is pretty much dedicated to improving the visual appearance of the car. These sections are: Autosculpt, Aftermarket and Visuals. The Aftermarket section allows you to install visual parts that are not by default installed on the car by the manufacturer while the Visuals section mostly tackles paint. In Autosculpt, you can modify Aftermarket parts like Bumpers and Roof Scoops to better suite you car. The procedure for installing a visual part is like that of a performance part, but the order is important, as shown in the next steps. Start off with the Aftermarket section. Scrolling rightwards on the Customization menu and pressing Enter when the category you want is highlighted. Select an Aftermarket category. The categories under Aftermarket include: Body Kit, Hood, and Wheels. Use the Left and Right Arrow keys to scroll from a category to the next. Select an Aftermarket upgrade. Use the Down and Up Arrow keys to highlight the upgrades/parts under the categories. Pressing Enter will put the part into your shopping cart. Go to Visuals. After Aftermarket, return to the Customization menu (Escape) and choose “Visuals.” Here you can select the paint color for different parts of the car, i.e., Body and Wheels. Scroll rightwards on the Visuals section and press Enter when the category you want is highlighted. Select a Visual category. Use the Left and Right Arrow keys to scroll from a category to the next. Select a Visual upgrade. Use the Down and Up Arrow keys to highlight the upgrades/parts under the categories. Pressing Enter will put the part into your shopping cart. Go to Autosculpt. After Visuals, return to the Customization menu (Escape) and choose “Autosculpt.” This is where you can modify the parts added from Aftermarket to your tastes. Select an Autosculpt upgrade. Categories under Autosculpt are identical those under Aftermarket and can be selected by scrolling leftwards or rightwards and pressing Enter. The Left and Right Arrow keys can be used to alter the parts, e.g., the positioning of a Roof Scoop or the height of a Bumper. Purchase your upgrade. The last part is to pay for the upgrades in the shopping cart and thus apply them to the car. Press Spacebar to view the shopping cart and Enter to complete the process. At this point, your car is much better than when you entered the Safe House! Installing a New Part in NFS Most Wanted 2012 (PC) Launch the game. You can launch it from the Start Menu (Start Button >> All Program >> Electronic Arts >> Need for Speed Most Wanted) or from the desktop by double-clicking its icon. When it finishes loading, the game will launch directly into the game world. Open the EasyDrive menu. Use the EasyDrive system to find races. EasyDrive is an in-game menu in the game that provides functions such as Customization, Race Selection, Car Changing, and Multiplayer. Press number 6 to bring up the EasyDrive Menu. Go to Races. Use number 2 to scroll down to the Races option and press number 6 to view available races. View available racs. Use number 8 and number 2 to scroll up and down respectively among the available races. Select a race. To accept a race, scroll down (number 2) to Start Race and press number 6 again. This will get you into the race. Go back to the EasyDrive menu. After winning the race, any unlocked parts will be available on the EasyDrive menu. Press number 6 to bring it up. Go to Customize Car. To do this, scroll to Customize Car using number 2. Select a customization option. Under Customize Car, you will find the following categories: Tires, Nitrous, Chassis, Body, and Transmission. Scroll to the part you unlocked (number 2 and number 8) by winning your race and press number 6 to select it. Install the upgrade. Press number 6 again to install the part.
